messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Free web hosting
messages.msgSnippet: Oh good grief!  Sorry. Here s the web site. www.1and1.com Kris ... From: Dnowens@aol.com [mailto:Dnowens@aol.com] Sent: Monday, October 13, 2003 7:07 AM To:
messages.messageBody:
Oh good grief! Sorry.

Here's the web site.

www.1and1.com

Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: Dnowens@... [mailto:Dnowens@...]
Sent: Monday, October 13, 2003 7:07 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Free web hosting

In a message dated 10/13/03 04:15:15 AM Central Daylight Time,
louisa@... writes:
An IT person told me (via a local hs list) about a new web hosting company
that is offering three years of free web hosting. I thought perhaps some
folks here might be interested in checking it out.

I have signed up but haven't begun using the service yet but it's supposed
to be the kind of service you would normally pay about $20 a month for.
They ask for your name and address but no credit card, they are based in
Europe and want to develop a US customer base.
##############

What is the site address? ;o) That might help.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Free web hosting
messages.msgSnippet: Kris Methinks you left something out of your post. You are not getting paid for sending folks where? ... Doug
messages.messageBody:
Kris

Methinks you left something out of your post.
You are not getting paid for sending folks where?

Message: 4
Date: Mon, 13 Oct 2003 02:14:09 -0700
From: "Kris" <louisa@...>
Subject: Free web hosting

An IT person told me (via a local hs list) about a new web hosting company
that is offering three years of free web hosting. I thought perhaps some
folks here might be interested in checking it out.

I have signed up but havent begun using the service yet but its supposed
to be the kind of service you would normally pay about $20 a month for.
They ask for your name and address but no credit card, they are based in
Europe and want to develop a US customer base.

Im not getting anything for sending folks to check it out, just thought it
might be of interest, maybe a good way for kids to develop their own web
pages.

Kris



.
.
